hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Catalyst Asymmetry in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes (VIX 15-25, BTC 20D vol 30-50%), unexpected single-day ETF flows (>$300M net) will generate 3x larger price impact per dollar flow compared to BULL/BEAR regimes, with flows preceding 10am ET having greatest amplification.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional bias, making flows more influential. Morning flows catch European/American overlap liquidity. Recent CPI whipsaw shows sensitivity to catalysts in uncertain environments.
entry_conditions: BTC price within 5% of 20D moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price move = 3x historical flow impact coefficient for regime
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price move < 1x historical flow impact coefficient
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close of next trading session (4pm ET)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price impact per $100M flow < 0.15% in neutral regime OR no significant difference from bull/bear regime impact.
